definition: to burn/to ignite/to light/fig. to spark off (hopes)/to start (debate)/to raise (hopes)
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
whip or lash/to flog/to whip/conductor's baton/segmented iron weapon (old)/penis (of animal, served as food)
to prepare herbal medicine by roasting or parching (in a pan)
to sauté/to fry/to dry by heating

sentences.english: We also enjoy making loud noise with firecrackers!
sentences.chinese: 我们也喜欢伴随著吵杂的声音燃放鞭炮。

sentences.english: The teenagers like to let off firecrackers.
Now it is not allowed to set off firecrackers in big cities on festivals.
sentences.chinese: 现在大城市在节假日里不允许燃放鞭炮。

sentences.english: Many boys explode firecrackers on the lantern Festival.
sentences.chinese: 许多男孩在元宵节燃放鞭炮。

sentences.english: In many places people like to set off firecrackers .
sentences.chinese: 在很多地方的人们还喜欢燃放鞭炮。

sentences.english: They set off firecrackers to celebrate the successful completion of the reservoir.
sentences.chinese: 他们燃放鞭炮庆祝水库的胜利建成。

definition: firecrackers set off at the stroke of midnight on New Year's Day (a Chinese tradition)
to burn paper offerings (as part of religious ceremony)
to clear waste land or forest by burning/slash-and-burn (agriculture)
joss paper made to resemble paper money
to respect a deity/to pray to a God
